definition: variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: My parents jack up my allowance, and I ll be maxing on cash.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母增加我的零用钱，我的现金就会很宽裕了。

sentences.english: He corrupted his cousin with money.
Take a cookie, for example. Butter comes from cows and cows cost money.
sentences.chinese: 以曲奇为例子，黄油来自奶牛，而奶牛需要用钱。

sentences.english: He tried to wriggle round the man with money,but he failed.
sentences.chinese: 他试着用钱巴结那个人，可是失败了。

sentences.english: Congmin offers money to retrieve the incriminatory evidence. Hongyuan quotes a price of 50million dollars.
sentences.chinese: 聪敏有求用钱赎回他的犯罪证据，宏远索价五千万。

sentences.english: Many children first learn the value of money by receiving an  allowance.
sentences.chinese: 许多孩子是在收到零用钱后才第一次认识到钱的价值。

sentences.english: Encourage children to put aside some of their pocket-money to buy Christmas presents.
sentences.chinese: 应鼓励孩子为圣诞礼物而积攒自己的零用钱。

sentences.english: The girls earn spending money by waiting at table in the school dining-room.
sentences.chinese: 这个女孩在学校餐厅当服务生以赚取零用钱。

sentences.english: Truly priceless treasures are made of love and cannot be purchased with money.
sentences.chinese: 真正的无价宝是出自真心，而非用钱能买到。

sentences.english: She used the money to start a typewriting business.
sentences.chinese: 她用钱开始干打字的营生。

sentences.english: My aunt is too tight- fisted.
Goods and services are traded for fiat money due to the need to pay taxes in the money.
sentences.chinese: 用货物和服务来换不兑换纸币是因为用钱缴税的需要。

sentences.english: How do you feel about yourself regarding the way how you spend your money?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得自己在用钱方面属于边个类型？

sentences.english: It seems that the wealthy can always get around crime(s) with money.
sentences.chinese: 富翁似乎都能用钱逃过犯罪。

sentences.english: I get less pocket-money than she.
sentences.chinese: 我得到的零用钱比她少。

sentences.english: Mum or dad,of course,provide a regular supply of pocket-money.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，爸爸妈妈会定期给零用钱的。

definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
lit. money will make the Devil turn millstones (idiom)/fig. with money, you can do anything you like
pinyin: you3 qian2 neng2 shi3 gui3 tui1 mo4
